p: In this study, the medicinal uses of natural compounds were identified by deep learning. To evaluate the predicted effects of the natural compounds, we performed evidence-based analysis ( Table 5). Firstly, we investigated in vitro and animal studies. 5-Caffeoylquinic acid may prevent cognitive impairment in mice with Alzheimer’s disease ( Ishida et al., 2020). Tangeretin may have therapeutic effects on rheumatoid arthritis in a rat model ( Li et al., 2019). Gossypol family members, such as BH3 mimetics, may have benefits in the management of rheumatoid arthritis ( Billard, 2013). Indolyl-methyl-glucosinolate was reported to exert anti-inflammatory activity ( Vo et al., 2014), and gentianine showed low anti-inflammatory activity in carrageenan-induced hind-paw edema ( Perez, 2001). Gambogic acid may ameliorate angiogenesis in mice with diabetic retinopathy ( Cui et al., 2018). Gamma-oryzanol was shown to be safe and effective in improving the conditions of diabetes mellitus in several animal studies ( Szcześniak et al., 2016). Octopamine may be involved in central blood pressure regulation ( Delbarre et al., 1982). According to the reperfusion duration, route of administration, and timing of the pretreatment regimen, resveratrol showed benefits in the treatment of myocardial infarct-sparing ( Mao et al., 2019). N-methyl-(R) salsolinol, as an endogenous neurotoxin, may induce Parkinson’s disease in rats ( Naoi et al., 1997). The proliferation of MDA-MB-231 cells was prohibited using neohesperidin in a time- and dose-dependent manner in human breast adenocarcinoma ( Xu et al., 2012). Tritiated norephedrine may inhibit the substitution of beta-phenylethylamines in rats ( Henderson et al., 1995). Agmatine protected brain tissues from edema after cerebral ischemia in mice ( Kim et al., 2010).
